numlitem.para: Flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration,

Procedures are established and used to verify main deck and lower lobe cargo compartments remain empty or contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), or Fly Away Kits,
Extended overwater flight is prohibited, and

Crew rests, crew workstations and passenger business centers with a door and smoke detection system (except the Combi Enlarged Lav/Business Center) are empty, locked closed and placard INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: &Ensuretheloadsupervisor;
With supernumeraries on board, en route altitude must be limited to 10,000 feet.
Equipment cooling may be operated in NORM or STBY.

If operation with Equipment Cooling in OVRD mode becomes necessary inflight, an unpressurized configuration yields insufficient equipment cooling. Flight time must therefore be limited to 60 minutes when in OVRD mode.
A minimum of two pack operation is required for unpressurized flight.
Flight will be unpressurized.
Flight is limited to an en route altitude of 10,000 feet with supernumeraries on board.
Main cargo deck and lower cargo holds remain empty, or contain only empty cargo handling equipment.
Flight must be within 60 minutes of an suitable airport.
Extended overwater flight is prohibited.
Crew rests area is empty, and secured closed.

placard.para: Placard associated Manual Outflow Valve "OUTFLOW VLVS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log. Placard the Upper Deck Crew Rest - "COMPARTMENT INOPERATIVE - DO NOT ENTER".

para.emphasis: BOTH OUTFLOW VALVES INOPERATIVE - UNPRESSURIZED FLIGHT

numlitem.para: Deactivate both left and right outflow valves open as detailed below:
Open and collar P6 panel CABIN PRESS CONT L ICU and CABIN PRESS CONT R ICU circuit breakers.
Open and collar P414 panel CABIN PRESS ICU LEFT and CABIN PRESS ICU RIGHT circuit breakers.
Determine position of both outflow valves. If not fully open, manually open by one of the following methods:
If manual control is available:
Select outflow valves to manual control (MAN L or MAN R ON), and drive valves fully open.
Deselect manual control (MAN L or MAN R OFF).
If manual control is not available:
Remove AC motor from both outflow valves per (AMM 21-31-06/401).

note.para: Caution should be taken so as not to lose AC motor shim plate.

numlitem.para: Open valves by applying torque to actuator output shaft.
Reinstall AC motor.
Check that the upper Deck Crew Rest (Freighter) compartment is empty, locked closed.
